poi.name: Kingston Locks
poi.description: Kingston mills features working locks, and is the site of the first mill built on the Rideau canal, called the Kings Mill. It is also the southern-most set of locks on the Rideau canal.
poi.address: Rideau Canal, Locks 46 - 49 - Kingston Mills, Kingston Mills Rd

poi.name: Kingston Market
poi.description: The Kingston market opens in the downtown market square most saturdays. Vendors from local businesses populate the stalls, and provide the opportunity to shop local producs.
poi.address: The Kingston Public Market, 216 Ontario St

poi.name: Kingston Penitentiary
poi.description: The Kingston Penitentiary is a former maximum security prison that now offers tours. The Penitentiary has been used as a set to film several movies and shows including Mayor of Kingstown, DC's Titans, and Star Trek: Discovery.

poi.name: Kingston Downtown
poi.description: The Kingston sign is a tourist attraction great for pictures and starting your journey through downtown Kingston.

poi.name: Lemoine Point
poi.description: The Lemoine Point Trail is a great spot of nature for those who enjoy walking trails. Bring some seeds to feed the birds!

poi.name: Confederation Park
poi.description: Located near the Kingston Sign, Confederation park features a wide view of the waterfront and docks. It is also located close to the Wolfe Island Ferry.

poi.name: Fort Henry
poi.description: Fort Henry provides a window into the past, featuring actors and artifacts from when the fort was in use. Cannons, soldiers, and beaver tails make the fort a must. The fort also hosts events during halloween like Pumpkinferno, and Fort Fright.
poi.address: Fort Henry National Historic Site, 1 Fort Henry Dr

poi.name: Beaver Tails
poi.description: Beaver Tails is a great place for those with a sweet tooth, featuring many variations of the popular friend pastry. Another place to string along your downtown adventure, come prepared for sticky, sugary goodness.
poi.address: BeaverTails- Queues de Castor (Kingston Market St.), 20 Market St
